intro: Byrsonima dubia, commonly known as wild cashew, is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed surrounded by a white, milky pulp. It is often found in dry forests and savannas, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
